DOC.brief_summary: In this prospective, randomized study The investigators will include 80 patients with late intraocular lens (IOL) dislocation in the capsular complex, after cataract surgery. To obtain normal visual function, these patients needs surgery. Today, there are two different methods used for this condition; scleral suturing of the capsular complex or exchange of IOL to an iris-fixated IOL (Verisyse). In this study the investigators will look for advantages and dis-advantages for these two methods.
DOC.brief_title: Late Dislocation of Intraocular Lens (IOL) Following Cataract Surgery: an Evaluation of Two Different Surgical Methods
DOC.criteria: patients with dislocation of IOL in the capsular complex who agree to participate in the study patients with total dislocation of the capsular complex' patients with reduced general health patients who can't be randomized
